page.title: 17TRAVELLING PEOPLE :Sheffield
page.content: In the Attercliffe and Darnall area there are up to 50 families of Gypsies {(travellers)}at any one time.There is an official site in the Lodge Moor area of Sheffield, but most prefer to stay on unofficial sites in Attercliffe where they can more easily carry on there scrap metal trading. Their accomodation ranges from very luxurious to spartan caravans with no proper beds. Because of the decline of local industry and a reduced demand for scrap metal many travellers have to live on{State benefits. Some still deal in horses which are regarded as status symbols. Many of the children attend{Phillimore Park {School}where there is a social worker looking after the travallers welfare and who encourages parents to keep their children at school permanently.
